trends: There have been 23 other sightings in Orange
There were no other sightings in Orange on or around May 14th 2010
Summary: Oscillating blue light that "leaped" horizontally per strobe.
divs: sighting detailsdriving northbound on the 55, between katella and lincoln shortly after 10:35pm, my friend and i noticed a very bright blue light that pulsated over the duration of approximately 2 seconds in an on\off pattern. it took about 0.75 seconds to fade from lit to unlit, waited approximately 2 seconds then another 0.75 or so seconds to light back up, then remained lit for another app. 2 seconds. also, there was a much smaller red light that seemed to be not so obvious and almost tucked into it, where it was only visible at certain times but not others. i don't believe in aliens visiting us, to be honest, and i would normally dismiss this as a low flying helicopter, specially given that there was a red and blue light, one could assume it was a police helicopter. however, this was not very low and proceeded to "leap" during the bright portions of the light cycle and i've also never seen a police helicopter pulsate and this length of oscillation. this light moved in correlation with the brightness in an almost logarithmic way. so as it lit up, it started to move faster until it was at full brightness where it maintained speed, then slowed down as the light dimmed again. it reminded us both of the children's game called leapfrog, except that it was completely lateral. there was a lot of apparently odd characteristics that left us both very confused. we are both very used to seeing police helicopters and even ordinary helicopters, but we were both convinced that this behaved unlike anything we've ever seen before. it's a little difficult to explain why this was to abnormal, but i'll try my best. as the light "dimmed" off the location seemed to slow. during it's off-cycle the light remained apparently stationary. then, during each "pulse" of light, it apparently gained speed until it was completely lit, dashed a few hundred yards, slowed down as the light dimmed, where it appeared to remain stationary again during it's off-cycle. i tried as hard as i could to debunk it, thinking maybe it was a stationary light that only appeared to move during the on-cycles, except that when we first saw it, we were 300 yards north from kattella and it's origin was to the left of the freeway (northwest of the 55 at lincoln), within approximately 1-2 minutes, after crossing under the meats overpass it was on the right (which was approximately southeast in the direction of katella to where it was over the hills that are by irvine regional park.) the freeway is very straight at this location and when it bent we lost sight of the light because of the roof of the car on the passengers side. if you look at this area you will see that if the light was at on the left during the straightaway, then it would have to be moving to be obscured by the back part of the roof of our vehicle at this bend. http:\\maps.google.com\?ie=utf8&ll=33.819303,-117.828112&spn=0.025564,0.049782&z=15 here's an idea of the direction of travel when compared to our location and it's apparent proximity to us. http:\\img.skitch.com\20100516-gg3b83hnb1mfnmmwefamtbwxmm.jpg this was a very interesting experience and we are not sure exactly what it was. we are also looking forward to any other witness testimony, i suppose in an attempt to solve this but at a minimum, at least prove that we are not crazy. either way, thank you for your time and please contact me directly if you saw this light, too. http:\\scr.im\nevery
